docs.snippet: Ex-players who oppose the N.F.L.’s concussion settlement struggle with the knowledge that they are keeping payments from others with life-threatening conditions like A.L.S....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ex-players who oppose the N.F.L.’s concussion settlement struggle with the knowledge that they are keeping payments from others with life-threatening conditions like A.L.S.
docs.abstract: Some 20,000 retired football players and their beneficiaries are wrestling with whether to accept or reject concussion settlement deal with NFL; decision presents moral quandary of whether to accept limited deal so that those in dire conditions can receive help quickly, or hold out for something better; issue is illustrated by plight of Kevin Turner, early organizer of lawsuit who suffers from Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis.

headline.seo: Former N.F.L. Players Make Difficult Choice in Opposing Concussion Settlement

docs.snippet: Christian Ballard and Gregory Westbrooks assert that the players association knew but did not disclose the dangers of hits to the head....
docs.lead_paragraph: Christian Ballard and Gregory Westbrooks assert that the players association knew but did not disclose the dangers of hits to the head.
docs.abstract: Retired football players Christian Ballard and Gregory Westbrooks sue NFL Players Assn for concealing from them information about dangers of repeated head hits; lawsuit echoes hundreds of similar cases against the NFL and may represent a new front in the legal battle over concussions in sports.

headline.main: Two Ex-Players Say Players Union Withheld Information
headline.print_headline: Two Ex-Players Say Players Union Withheld Information

docs.snippet: Daktronics, in Brookings, S.D., has become one of the largest makers of sports video displays as teams try to recreate the living room experience in their parks....
docs.lead_paragraph: Daktronics, in Brookings, S.D., has become one of the largest makers of sports video displays as teams try to recreate the living room experience in their parks.
docs.abstract: Daktronics has become one of the largest manufacturers of giant LED video displays in sports arenas and stadiums, as teams attempt to recreate 'living room experience' for fans. Jacksonville Jaguars are among teams that have installed high-definition video boards in attempt to lure fans from their big screens at home.

headline.seo: Daktronics Plays Outsize Role as Giant Scoreboards Proliferate

docs.snippet: Shahid Khan is the owner of the Jacksonville Jaguars, a team that hasn’t made the playoffs since the 2007 season. He is spending $20 million of his own money on the biggest end-zone video displays....
docs.lead_paragraph: Shahid Khan is the owner of the Jacksonville Jaguars, a team that hasn’t made the playoffs since the 2007 season. He is spending $20 million of his own money on the biggest end-zone video displays.

docs.snippet: An investigation found that a coach had made a homophobic statement to Chris Kluwe, a punter who says he was released over his support of same-sex marriage, but refuted other allegations....
docs.lead_paragraph: An investigation found that a coach had made a homophobic statement to Chris Kluwe, a punter who says he was released over his support of same-sex marriage, but refuted other allegations.
docs.abstract: Minnesota Vikings say six-month investigation has refuted many of the charges made by team’s former punter, Chris Kluwe, who claimed that he was released in 2013 in retaliation for his public support of same-sex marriage.

headline.main: Vikings Say Report Contradicts Many of Kluwe’s Claims
headline.print_headline: Vikings Say Report Contradicts Many of Kluwe’s Claims

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

docs.snippet: A brief pro stint could have kept him out of West Point, making his presidency unlikely....
docs.lead_paragraph: A brief pro stint could have kept him out of West Point, making his presidency unlikely.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; Michael Beschloss History Source column recalls that Dwight D Eisenhower briefly and secretly played semiprofessional baseball before attending West Point; notes that choice was technically a violation of school's honor code and could conceivably have prevented him from becoming a general and ultimately a president; notes that story has reverberations in the current debate about whether college athletes should be deemed school employees.

headline.print_headline: The Pro Who Shadowed Eisenhower’s Career

docs.snippet: The Minnesota Vikings will suspend special teams coordinator Mike Priefer without pay for three games this season and donate $100,000 to lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender rights groups, in response to former punter Chris Kluwe's allegations o...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Minnesota Vikings will suspend special teams coordinator Mike Priefer without pay for three games this season and donate $100,000 to lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender rights groups, in response to former punter Chris Kluwe's allegations of anti-gay slurs and taunts made by Priefer.
